body:
If we put any string, other than "%n" , as notes divider the app only shows blank spaces.
Example: `<notes_divider value="| ">`
The intent is to show notes in one line, one after the other separated by "|", but the result is a space between notes.

title: Trying to run .sh scripts -> permission denied
body:
I tried to add a simple test shell script

```
#!/bin/sh
echo "test"
```

I created a subfolder and the file inside t-ui (I tried it outside of the t-ui folder too)
```
mkdir t-ui/scripts
touch test.sh
```

when I tried to start the script with
`./test.sh`

I got:

> t-ui/scripts/test.sh: can't execute: Permission denied

I tried chmod
`chmod 755 test.sh`
but got

> Operation not permitted

I'm lost. What am I missing? I wasn't able to find anything about shell scripts in t-ui.

title: Possible to add google calendar in to main screen?
Root command suggestion
body:
Just a quick suggestion for those that are rooted (and for the wiki). In the behavior settings put:
```
<double_tap_lock value="false"/> <double_tap_cmd value='su -c "input keyevent POWER"'/>
```
This will simulate a button power press instead of locking the device as admin

title: Notification longpress -> "Exclude notification" doesn't create filters that work.
body:
Notification longpress -> "Exclude notification" creates filters like: `<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncing… --- Title "/>` and `<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is running --- null"/>`. `%t` and `%pkg`  appear to be breaking the filter. Should they be replaced before the regex is checked? Or perhaps create a value string and in it replace `%t` with a time regex and `%pkg`/`%app' with the package/app name? I've replaced them with working regexes, but it took me a while to get to the issue.
```
<filter value="Syncthing is running"/>
<!--<filter value="Syncthing: Syncing…"/>-->
<filter value="Syncthing is disabled"/>
```

The path to discovering the issue:

![screenshot_20180707-063811](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1442484/42573566-adf94084-84d9-11e8-9cf7-5d55c8fea023.png)
longpressing the notification and selecting "Exclude notification" put these in the notifications.xml file:
```
<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncing… --- Title "/>
...
<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is running --- null"/>
<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is disabled --- null"/>
<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is running --- null"/>
<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is disabled --- null"/>
```
but they weren't working. I cleaned up the extras, and found that if I comment out the "Syncing… --- Title" one then it appears to filter the notifications;
```
<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is running --- null"/>
<!--<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncing… --- Title "/>-->
<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is disabled --- null"/>
```

I also noticed that if I apply a non negative id and create an "apply", then it also starts filter these notifications:
```
<apply id="3" package="com.nutomic.synthingandroid"/>
<filter id="3" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is running --- null"/>
<filter id="3" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncing… --- Title "/>
<filter id="3" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is disabled --- null"/>
```

And by "work" i mean, they appear to be all or nothing. I can't get them to go one at a time. This also prevents all notifications.
```
<!--<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is running --- null"/>
<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncing… --- Title "/>-->
<filter id="-1" value="[%t] %pkg: Syncthing is disabled --- null"/>
```

Looking at the documentation, apply isn't a thing anymore? I'll have to re-work some filters now. I tried limiting the "value" and that seems to work.
```
<filter value="Syncthing is running"/>
<!--<filter value="Syncthing: Syncing…"/>-->
<filter value="Syncthing is disabled"/>
```

title: RSS Manager: Locale inDate parsing
body:
When the language of the phone is not english, the RSS Manager fails to parse most dates (due to time format `EEE` and `MMM` being locale-dependent).
For information the failure message is `The time format couldn't be parsed`. It may be useful to update the wiki with it.

You should force the locale of the `SimpleDateFormat`. A dedicated constructor exists for this purpose: `public SimpleDateFormat (String pattern, Locale locale)` ([reference](https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/SimpleDateFormat#SimpleDateFormat(java.lang.String,%20java.util.Locale)))

As an enhancement, adding an additional option to set the locale per RSS feed may be useful.

title: Not really usable with hardware keyboard (like Motorola Droid4/xt894)
body:
Hi,

thx for great T-UI which is unfortunately not really usable with a hardware keyboar, example:

When I want to open "settings" I type `s` on my hardware keyboard.
Now there is no input possible anymore (no more hardware typing possible) and t-ui suggests "ls", to go on typing with hardware keyboard I have to tap one time on my display into command line.
Now I type `e` to complete "settings", input stops again and suggests "search" and "ls".
I have to tap again one time into command line to type `t` - now I can choose "settings".

So it would be nice if you could just type as much as you want and t-ui would suggest whatever fits but without any interruptions I've described. Possible?

PS: I've reported this before as part of https://github.com/Andre1299/TUI-ConsoleLauncher/issues/97 but this issues was closed today. After testing T-UI (F-Droid version) today again I noticed that it has the same behaviour using hardware keyboards as described above.

title: Feature Request - Home Reply to Individual Chat Thread
body:
Thanks for implementing the **Hold** and **Reply Last Notification**. This is getting awesome.

It's a longshot - but instead of replying only to last notification, is it possible to reply to the individual **chat** thread. Basically, the actual chat with the person that I **hold** and **reply**.

Basically remove the limitation of just able to reply to the last chat but allow to reply to any chat messages. The reason being is that often someone else sent me a message before I could hit enter and the message simply went to the wrong person. It's been fun.

i.e. 
01:56 PM - TUI >> WhatsApp > Andrew : How's it going?
01:58 PM - TUI >> WhatsApp > Bobby : What's for dinner?

I can press and hold "Andrew" and click reply and the message is sent to Andrew instead of Bobby.

Thank you.

title: Switching user
body:
I am currently running TUI on a Nethunter installation and was pondering possible integration with the Kali shell.

There is a built in terminal ("Nethunter Terminal") which enables selecting which shell to start (Android/Kali).
TUI currently shows the selected user as the default Android user, in my case:
user@hammerhead
This is the same user as selecting "Android" in the Nethunter terminal app.

After some decompiling and research of the app I noticed that it uses the following commands for shell switching (as per com.offsec.nhterm package):
Android shell (no root, same as TUI): sh -
Android shell (SU): su
Kali shell: su -c /system/bin/bootkali
Kali login shell:su -c /system/bin/bootkali_login

Manually entering the above commands through TUI fails to switch shells, and through the login shell it does not produce and output to commands (maybe it did switch but not supported?)

Is there an option to support the shell switching?

title: Modify search help text to reflect ability to open arbitrary URL
body:
Not sure if this was intentionally excluded, but I just found out (through wanting a feature and searching the source) that I can use search to open any URL with -u. If this is an intentional feature, perhaps we should make this known in the help text?
https://github.com/Andre1299/TUI-ConsoleLauncher/blob/919c891498813f680a22cc3ccbaae82b50bdc313/app/src/main/res/values/strings.xml#L211-L218

Perhaps add the following line (or something similar)?
```
    <string name="help_search">Search something somewhere
        \n\nUsage:
        ......
        \n-u [search this...] ->  Open browser to any URL
    </string>
```

My motivation for this was the ability directly open Google Map searchs, so I now use the following alias:
map=search -u https://www.google.com/maps?q=%
Since Google Maps automatically opens /maps URLs, this gives me kind of an "Open Google Maps with the following search query" hack

title: Adding font customization (revised)
body:
I reworked the font customization feature based on the latest commit.

Usage: Place your own font file in the location as defined in the user_font_path parameter in UI.xml, and the font will be loaded for text display. If the file fails to load for whatever reason, the built-in font will be used instead.

Additionally, for convenience I merged the system_font check into the getFont method as well, so on top of loading the user-defined font, it'll return the default system Typeface (Typeface.DEFAULT) when system_font parameter is set true.

title: Any way to properly suppress ongoing notifications?
body:
Just pulled the recent upstream changes and made a build, and found out the now working "show notification" feature is flooding my ongoing notifications (special notifications that cannot be cleared) all over the place (or precisely, the T-UI would print the ongoing notification whenever its contents changed, which can be frequent, especially if the ongoing notification is from some kind of monitor app that polls on something that's constantly changing like CPU or network traffic). Also, it seems by default it can even print some system notifications like the "change keyboard" notification, which isn't something I'd want it to appear.

So far I could only see ways to control notifications per app, globally or through regex (can be app-specific). It might be better to have switches that allow suppressing ongoing notifications, or print all notifications (regardless of type) only once. At present, it's a bit too complicated to use as I was just looking for a way to suppress nothing but ongoing notifications a while ago...

By the way, does anyone know what I should add in the notifications configuration XML in order to suppress system notifications like "change keyboard"?

EDIT: Should clarify that I've not touched the code related to the notifications feature...

title: Typo in UIManager breaks %eavmb display.
body:
I was planning to merge the recent upstream changes into my fork and found out the typo that broke %eavmb is still there, causing a merge conflict as I have corrected it back then.

At line 197 as of commit 27fc5e6:
`copy = storagePatterns.get(14).matcher(copy).replaceAll(Matcher.quoteReplacement(String.valueOf(Tuils.formatSize((long) eav, Tuils.MEGA))));
`

The storagePattern to get here should be 13. 14 corresponds to Tuils.KILO (%eavkb, the next line, which is correct).

title: Implementation of the features I proposed in issue #100 and #101.
body:
This is my implementation of the following features I proposed in issue #100 and tested OK on my device. Some refactors included to help keeping most of the added code in one place, though not perfect.

- Use the system monospace font instead of default, when configured to use system font.
- The ability to use a user-provided font in the path specified in the ui.xml file (the default value is merely an example). The Lucida Console font included in the app package will be loaded instead, in case the user-provided font file is not found or invalid.

There may still be some more rooms for style customizations, I think.

title: External storage space display not reliable on new Android versions.
body:
It seems T-UI looks for the environment variable SECONDARY_STORAGE for getting the external storage space information, but this doesn't work on Nougat (in my case, AOKP for ASUS Zenfone 2 Z00A) as I found out there was no SECONDARY_STORAGE variable (only EXTERNAL_STORAGE variable which points to /sdcard which in turn points to the internal storage, /data/media), and the external SD card is mounted differently depending on the SD card partition.

If the SD card has been configured as external storage, the SD card will be mounted in /storage/XXXX-XXXX, where XXXX-XXXX is the volume serial number if the SD card is formatted as FAT32 or exFAT, which is different among cards, and different values will be assigned whenever the card is reformatted, making manually setting a SECONDARY_STORAGE value in the system a bad idea.

As such, it may be helpful to allow users to manually specify the location of the SD card from within the app so the external storage space display can continue to work as intended and without compromising other system functions.

title: [Feature Request] Allow more font customization options.
body:
At present, setting the system_font parameter to true makes T-UI use the normal system font which may not look good as a terminal font. It may be better if the system built-in monospace font (DroidSansMono.ttf) can be used instead.

Or consider allowing users to set their own fonts on their internal storage (maybe fall back to default if not found) so we can choose whatever font we like to use on T-UI.

EDIT 4: Wrapped up the implementations and created pull request #106.

title: Add common prefix suggestions
body:
There are many suggestions starting with a common prefix, e.g., "Play Books", "Play Music", "Play Movies & TV" and so forth.  Either you scroll in the suggestion list in order to find the entry you are looking for, or you continue typing to narrow it down.

With this patch, if there is a common prefix to all current completions (which really start with the current input), then this common prefix is added to the front of the list as an additional suggestion.  In the example above, that common prefix would be "play ".

title: [Feature Request] [Developer] AIDL based plugin system
body:
Hi,

Currently every new feature is being added in the main app and not everyone needs every feature.
Let's say for example if someone wants a feature like checking stock price of a particular stock with a command. It's not relevant for everyone but some people might need it.
So, it can be distributed as a separate app on Play Store and whoever needs that functionality can just install the plugin and that can appear in launcher. In the current feature set "calc" and "music player" can be moved out as plugins.

This functionality can be implemented using AIDL based plugin system where there is a common interface with basic types for communication between two apps.

Let me know if this sounds good. I'll create a PR for this.

The default launcher creates shortcuts for newly installed apps, which allows you to get used to new apps (and eventually keep shortcut, remove or uninstall).

title: [Feature request] call specific number instead of first number found
body:
When I type `call <<contact_name>>`, a phone number is automatically chosen from the contact.
**I'd like to choose which number I call**, if there are multiple stored.

### Background:
For many contacts I have stored both a mobile phone and a home number. Most of the time I'd rather like to call the mobile number, but the home number is chosen automatically.

### Idea:
I'd like to specify which number to call. This could be done e.g. with `call <<contact_name>> mobile`. If this is not specified, but there are multiple numbers for a contact, list the numbers available, e.g.
```
<<contact_name>>:
    (1) home:   + XX XXXX XXXXXXX
    (2) mobile: + XX XXXX XXXXXXX
```
One could apply a counter and allow commands like `call <<contact_name>> 1` as well.

If this is possible by the architecture of the launcher, one could allow a two step command:
```
$ call <<contact_name>>
available numbers:
    (1) home:   + XX XXXX XXXXXXX
    (2) mobile: + XX XXXX XXXXXXX
$ 1
calling home
```

### Implementation:
If you think this is a good idea, I'd consider looking into the source myself and implementing this. I could use some pointers to get started, though.
I'd be happy if you could tell me what is easily possible from a design PoV (e.g. the two-step command).

title: Rename TerminalMAnager.java to TerminalManager.java, closes #44
body: Java requires public classes to be stored inside files using the same name. This applies to case-sensitivity as well, when the file system supports it.

title: UIManager/SuggestionRunnable R.id missing

title: [Feature Request] sending SMS
body:
Usage:
>>sms -t John Smith
Would open the default SMS app to a conversation with a contact named John Smith
>>sms --to John Smith
A synonym of the previous one.
>>sms -t 18005551234
Same as the first two, except it takes a phone number as an argument.
>>sms --message This is a message.
opens the default SMS app to a draft with the given message to a blank recipient
>>sms -m This is a message draft.
Same as previous
>>sms -t John Smith -m John, Programming is fun.
Opens the default sms app to a draft with the given message to a contact named John Smith. This shall not send the message. 
>>sms -t John Smith -t George Washington -t Abe Lincoln -m Happy 4th of July
This opens a the default sms app to a draft of the given message to multiple recipients. Again, this doesn't send anything. 

If a contact name  or message contains -t, --to, -m, or --message, then we can quote the string. 
>>sms -t John Smith -m "John, you can use the -m option to send a message"

If a contact name or message contains the quotation  mark character, it should still work. You could probably achieve that with a regular expression.

title: [Feature Request] Add DuckDuckGo as a search option
body: I have been using the console launcher for a while. Currently, the terminal search provides google, play store, youtube and files as option. I suggest we add duckduckgo within the supported options as well. That will allow the user to target a wider search options via bangs(!).

title: Merged #34 and Fixed Fuzzy Matching of App Names
body: Also added new default in settings.txt to take advantage of fuzzy matching. See #34 for tweaks merged here for a cleaner UI. The launcher is a joy to use with fuzzy matching enabled.

title: HTC Help interferes with help command
body: I'm using an HTC One M8, which includes an app called 'HTC Help', and T-UI. Unfortunately, the 'Help' command opens 'HTC Help' instead of anything useful. And as 'HTC Help' has proven remarkably adamant in not being deleted, I have come here instead. Could you please prevent the 'help' command from opening apps?

title: Can't select in TerminalView
body:
Hi,

new "ConsoleLauncher" user here. I really like your launcher and it replaced my KISS launcher but I found a bug that i want to report.

In the terminal view i'm not able to select output. logcat says "W/TextView: TextView does not support text selection. Action mode cancelled." I've looked at the source code and it seems that it should be intended to select text from the terminal text view "android:textIsSelectable="true" .

If it is not intended to select text right now it would be great to have this feature.

title: Add better (fuzzy) search
body:
In the lines of: https://github.com/Neamar/KISS/pull/379

Right now it kinda finds stuff, but not always:
- I have to enter 3 characters before it even starts to find something (yes commands like `cp` show up but not apps/contacts), it should show suggestions after the first character
- suggestions are strange:
  - write `c` you get `c cd cp`
  - write `c`, I even at one time got `c cd cp cp Contact Name` but not `call`
  - continue to `ca`, you get `call a c`, where do the `a` and `c` invalid commands come from?
  - continue to `cal`, you get `call alias clear flash` wth?!?!
  - write `ftp`, you get `stop` although I have an app called `something ftps`
